profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:15-0400

did.unittitle: Journal of occurrences in the Creek agency, 1802
did.abstract: Journal covers agency affairs at Tookaubatchee, January 23-July 1, 1802. Includes meetings with Creek Indians; treaty negotiations at Fort Wilkinson; relevant correspondence.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donor, Francis W. Rawle, through John Witthoft, 1954.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Permission must be obtained for any duplication of these materials.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Also on this microfilm reel is Hugh Young's "A topographic memoir on East and West Florida" (1818). See RLIN entry PAAV89-A10.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Benjamin Hawkins was an Indian agent and United States Senator.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: Originals in Library Company of Philadelphia.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This is a microfilm of an early American collection that may be of interest to researchers at the APS and may complement an original manuscript collection at the APS.
